descr.p: The wtex unit provides TTexWriter, a concrete implementation of TFormattingWriter that generates LaTeX output. This class implements all the abstract formatting methods to produce valid LaTeX markup for documents, tables, and lists using standard LaTeX commands and environments.

TTexWriter is a concrete implementation of TFormattingWriter that generates LaTeX output. It implements all formatting methods to produce valid LaTeX markup including document structure, text formatting, tables, and lists. The class properly escapes LaTeX special characters and uses standard LaTeX commands and environments.

element.name: TTexWriter.FCellCount
element.short: Internal counter for table cell positions

descr.p: FCellCount is used internally to track the current cell position within a table row. It is reset at the beginning of each row and incremented for each cell to determine when to insert column separators (&) in LaTeX tables.
Writes an opening brace ({) to begin a LaTeX scope or command argument. This is a utility method used by other formatting methods to create properly scoped LaTeX constructs.
Writes a closing brace (}) to end a LaTeX scope or command argument. This is a utility method used by other formatting methods to create properly scoped LaTeX constructs.

element.name: TTexWriter.EnvironmentStart
element.short: Begins LaTeX environment with optional parameters

descr.p: Writes a LaTeX \begin command for the specified environment name. If options are provided, they are included before the environment name. This is a utility method for creating LaTeX environments.
Writes a LaTeX \end command for the specified environment name. This is a utility method for properly closing LaTeX environments.
Escapes LaTeX special characters in text to prevent them from being interpreted as commands. Currently replaces underscore (_) characters with escaped underscores (\_).

Begins a LaTeX document by writing the document class, package includes, document environment, and title command. Generates \documentclass{report}, \usepackage{a4}, \begin{document}, and \title{} markup.
Ends a LaTeX document by writing the \end{document} command.
Begins a LaTeX section header by writing the appropriate sectioning command based on the level. Level 0 generates \part, level 1 generates \chapter, level 2 generates \section, etc.
Ends a LaTeX section header by writing the closing brace and adding a blank line.
Ends a LaTeX paragraph by writing two line feeds to create a paragraph break.
Inserts a LaTeX line break by writing the \\ command.
Inserts a LaTeX horizontal rule by writing the \hline command.
Begins LaTeX bold text formatting by writing the \textbf command and opening brace.
Ends LaTeX bold text formatting by writing the closing brace.
Begins LaTeX italic text formatting by writing the \textit command and opening brace.
Ends LaTeX italic text formatting by writing the closing brace.
Begins LaTeX underline text formatting by writing the \textul command and opening brace.
Ends LaTeX underline text formatting by writing the closing brace.
Begins a LaTeX verbatim environment where text is displayed exactly as entered with fixed-width font and preserved formatting.
Ends a LaTeX verbatim environment.
Begins a LaTeX tabular environment with column specifications. Generates column specification with left-aligned columns (l) based on the number of columns specified.

element.name: TTexWriter.TableStart.Border
element.short: Border flag (not used in LaTeX implementation)

descr.p: Ends a LaTeX tabular environment.
Begins a LaTeX table row by resetting the cell counter to zero.
Ends a LaTeX table row by writing the row terminator (\\) followed by a line break.
Begins a LaTeX table cell by writing the column separator (&) if this is not the first cell in the row. Increments the internal cell counter.
Begins a LaTeX table header cell by calling CellStart. LaTeX does not distinguish between header and regular cells in the tabular environment.
Ends a LaTeX table header cell by calling CellEnd. LaTeX does not require special handling for header cell endings in the tabular environment.
Begins a LaTeX list environment based on the list type. Uses enumerate for numbered lists, itemize for ordered lists, and definition for definition lists based on the ListNames array.

element.name: TTexWriter.ListStart.ListType
element.short: Type of LaTeX list to create

descr.p: Ends a LaTeX list environment by writing the appropriate \end command. Uses the ListNames array to determine the correct environment name.

element.name: TTexWriter.ListEnd.ListType
element.short: Type of LaTeX list being ended

descr.p: Begins a LaTeX list item by writing the \item command.
Creates a LaTeX definition list item by writing \item with the name in square brackets followed by the definition text.

element.name: TTexWriter.DefinitionItem.Aname
element.short: Term being defined (placed in square brackets)

element.name: ListNames
element.short: LaTeX environment names for different list types

descr.p: ListNames is an array constant that maps TListType enumeration values to their corresponding LaTeX list environment names. Contains 'enumerate' for numbered lists, 'itemize' for ordered lists, and 'definition' for definition lists.
